Package org.gearvrf.asynchronous

Implementation of asynch resource loading.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Scheduler
    This is the interface for a scheduler which executes tasks for loading GVRf resources.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AsyncManager  
    CompressedTexture
    Represents a texture file, loaded into memory.
    GVRAsynchronousResourceLoader
    Internal API for asynchronous resource loading.
    GVRAsynchronousResourceLoader.FutureResource<T extends GVRHybridObject>  
    GVRCompressedTexture
    A GL compressed texture; you get it from GVRAsynchronousResourceLoader.loadTexture(GVRContext, org.gearvrf.utility.ResourceCache, org.gearvrf.GVRAndroidResource.CancelableCallback, org.gearvrf.GVRAndroidResource, int, int) This is mostly an internal, implementation class: You may find GVRCompressedTexture.mLevels and/or GVRCompressedTexture.mQuality useful.
    GVRCompressedTextureLoader
    Implement this class to use compressed texture formats that GVRF does not support.
    GVRCompressedTextureLoader.Reader
    Utility class for reading big- and little-endian numbers from a header
    SyncScheduler
    This is an implementation of the resource loading scheduler, which blocks until each resource is loaded.

Package org.gearvrf.asynchronous Description

Implementation of asynch resource loading. Most classes are hidden, implementation details. You need to implement GVRCompressedTextureLoader to use compressed texture formats that GVRF does not support; you may find GVRCompressedTexture useful for debugging. GVRAsynchronousResourceLoader is public only so that GVRContext can make cross-package calls: It is an official part of the API, but we suggest you avoid using it directly.
Since:
1.6.1
